name: generic_case_notification_message_mapping_guide_v1_0
description: This Message Mapping Guide describes the content and message mapping specifications for the set of data elements used to communicate information to meet the requirements for Generic Case Notifications to CDC.  The intended audiences for this document are the state/local and CDC programs and other public health related organizations interested in using the HL7 V2.5 Case Notification Message Specification for transmitting their data elements to CDC.

elements.name: Notification ID
elements.description: The unique identifier for the notification record.

hl7v251.messageContext: MSH-10-Message Control ID.
hl7v251.implementationNotes: If notification ID is not unique, a timestamp may be appended.  No UID or label is passed in the message.

elements.name: Receiving Application
elements.description: CDC's PHIN Common Data Store (CDS) is the Receiving Application for this message.

hl7v251.messageContext: MSH-5-Receiving Application.
hl7v251.implementationNotes: Literal Value: ‘PHINCDS^2.16.840.1.114222.4.3.2.10^ISO'

elements.name: Message Profile ID
elements.description:
First instance is the reference to the structural specification used to validate the message.
Second instance is the reference to the PHIN Message Mapping Guide from which the content is derived.

hl7v251.messageContext: MSH-21-Message Profile ID.
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
First instance literal value: ‘NND_ORU_v2.0^PHINProfileID^2.16.840.1.114222.4.10.3^ISO'
Second instance literal value: ‘Gen_Case_Map_v1.0^PHINMsgMapID^2.16.840.1.114222.4.10.4^ISO’.

elements.name: Local Subject ID
elements.description: The local ID of the Subject/Entity.

hl7v251.messageContext: PID-3-Patient Identifier List

elements.name: Subject Name Type
elements.description: Name is not requested by the program, but the Patient Name field is required to be populated for the HL7 message to be valid.  Have adopted the HL7 convention for processing a field where the name has been removed for de-identification purposes.

hl7v251.messageContext: PID-5.7-Patient Name Type
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
Literal value:  |~^^^^^^S|

Patient Name Type is passed in the second instance as HL7 reserves the first instance of the name field for Legal Name.

elements.name: Birth Date
elements.description: Date of birth in YYYYMMDD format

hl7v251.messageContext: PID-7-Date/Time of Birth
hl7v251.implementationNotes: The UID and label are not passed in the message.

elements.name: Subject’s Sex
elements.description: Subject’s current sex.

hl7v251.messageContext: PID-8-Administrative Sex
hl7v251.implementationNotes: The UID and label are not passed in the message.

elements.name: Race Category
elements.description: Field containing one or more codes that broadly refer to the Subject’s race(s).

hl7v251.messageContext: PID-10-Race
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
To send an "Unknown" because the application allows Unknown to be selected (that is, not as a default value): PID-10 would appear as |UNK^Unknown^NULLFL|

The UID and label are not passed in the message.

elements.name: Subject's Address County
elements.description: County of residence of the subject.

hl7v251.messageContext: PID-11.9-Patient Address  - County
hl7v251.implementationNotes: The entire address construct (PID-11) may repeat per HL7 but only expecting the first instance to be populated and parsed.

elements.name: Subject's Address State
elements.description: State of residence of the subject.

hl7v251.messageContext: PID-11.4-Patient Address  - State
hl7v251.implementationNotes: The entire address construct (PID-11) may repeat per HL7 but only expecting the first instance to be populated and parsed.

elements.name: Subject's Address Zip Code
elements.description: ZIP Code of residence of the subject.

hl7v251.messageContext: PID-11.5-Patient Address  - Postal Code
hl7v251.implementationNotes: The entire address construct (PID-11) may repeat per HL7 but only expecting the first instance to be populated and parsed.

elements.name: Ethnic Group Code
elements.description: Ethnic origin or ethnicity is based on the individual’s self-identity of the Subject as Hispanic or Latino.

hl7v251.messageContext: PID-22-Ethnic Group
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
To send an "Unknown" because the application allows Unknown to be selected (that is, not as a default value): PID-22 would appear as |UNK^Unknown^NULLFL|

The UID and label are not passed in the message.

elements.name: Local Record ID
elements.description: Sending system-assigned local ID of the case investigation with which the Subject is associated.

hl7v251.messageContext: OBR-3-Filler Order Number
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
OBR-3.1 is the internally assigned case/investigation ID.

OBR-3.3 is the OID for sending application as assigning authority.

OBR-3.4 is the literal value: 'ISO'.  

The same value is used for each OBR segment, and the UID and label are not passed in the message.

elements.name: Subject Type
elements.description: Type of subject for the notification.  "Person", "Place/location", or "Non-Person Living Subject" are the appropriate subject types for Notifications to CDC.

hl7v251.messageContext: First OBR Segment-OBR-4-Universal Service ID.
hl7v251.implementationNotes: Literal value:  'PERSUBJ^Person Subject^CDCPHINVS'

elements.name: Notification Type
elements.description: Type of notification. Notification types are "Individual Case",  "Environmental", "Summary", and "Laboratory Report".

hl7v251.messageContext: Second OBR Segment-OBR-4-Universal Service ID.
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
Literal Value:  'NOTF^Individual Case Notification^CDCPHINVS'

No UID or label is passed in the message.

elements.name: Date First Submitted
elements.description: Date/time the notification was first sent to CDC.  This value does not change after the original notification.

hl7v251.messageContext: OBR-7-Observation Date/time.
hl7v251.implementationNotes: The same value is used for each OBR segment, and the UID and label are not passed in the message.

elements.name: Date of Report
elements.description: Date/time this version of the notification was sent.  It will be the same value as NOT103 for the original notification.  For updates, this is the update/send date/time.

hl7v251.messageContext: OBR-22-Result Report/Status Chg Date/time.
hl7v251.implementationNotes: The same value is used for each OBR segment, and the UID and label are not passed in the message.

elements.name: Condition Code
elements.description: Condition or event that constitutes the reason the notification is being sent.

hl7v251.messageContext: OBR-31-Reason for Study.
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
Default value in each OBR instance:  'Event Code^Event Description^NND'   

The UID and label are not passed in the message.

elements.name: Reporting State
elements.description: State reporting the notification.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label
hl7v251.implementationNotes: Two digit numeric FIPS code

elements.name: National Reporting Jurisdiction
elements.description: National jurisdiction reporting the notification to CDC.  This will be the same value as NOT109 Reporting State for all reporting jurisdictions except New York City.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Jurisdiction Code
elements.description: Identifier for the physical site from which the notification is being submitted.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label
hl7v251.implementationNotes: Jurisdiction Code is expected in the fifth component of the CWE datatype.

elements.name: Case Investigation Status Code
elements.description: Status of the investigation.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Investigation Date Assigned
elements.description: Date the investigator was assigned to this investigation.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Date of Report/Referral
elements.description: Date the event or illness was first reported by the reporting source (physician or lab reported to the local/county/state health department).

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Reporting Source Type Code
elements.description: Type of facility or provider associated with the source of information sent to Public Health.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Reporting Source Zip Code
elements.description: Zip Code of the reporting source for this case.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Earliest Date Reported to County
elements.description: Earliest date reported to county public health system

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Earliest Date Reported to State
elements.description: Earliest date reported to state public health system

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Was the patient hospitalized as a result of this event?
elements.description: Was patient hospitalized as a result of this event?

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Admission Date
elements.description: Subject’s admission date to the hospital for the condition covered by the investigation

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Discharge Date
elements.description: Subject's discharge date from the hospital for the condition covered by the investigation

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Duration of Hospital Stay in Days
elements.description: Subject's duration of stay at the hospital for the condition covered by the investigation

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Diagnosis Date
elements.description: Date of diagnosis of condition being reported to public health system

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Date of Illness Onset
elements.description: Date of the beginning of the illness.  Reported date of the onset of symptoms of the condition being reported to the public health system

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Illness End Date
elements.description: Time at which the disease or condition ends.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Illness Duration
elements.description: Length of time this person had this disease or condition.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Illness Duration Units
elements.description: Unit of time used to describe the length of the illness or condition.

hl7v251.messageContext: OBX-6-Units
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
Part of the INV139 Observation/OBX Segment.

The UID and label are not passed in the message.

elements.name: Did the patient die from this illness?
elements.description: Did the patient die from this illness or complications of this illness?

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Deceased Date
elements.description: If the patient died from this illness or complications associated with this illness, indicate the date of death

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Investigation Start Date
elements.description: The date the case investigation was initiated

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Case Outbreak Indicator
elements.description: Denotes whether the reported case was associated with an identified outbreak

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Case Outbreak Name
elements.description: A state-assigned name for an indentified outbreak

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Case Disease Imported Code
elements.description: Indication of where the disease/condition was likely acquired.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Imported Country
elements.description: If the disease or condition was imported, indicates the country in which the disease was likely acquired.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label
hl7v251.implementationNotes: Three letter country code

elements.name: Imported State
elements.description: If the disease or condition was imported, indicates the state in which the disease was likely acquired.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label
hl7v251.implementationNotes: Two digit numeric FIPS code

elements.name: Imported City
elements.description: If the disease or condition was imported, indicates the city in which the disease was likely acquired.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label
hl7v251.implementationNotes: One to ten digit numeric GNIS Feature ID

elements.name: Imported County
elements.description: If the disease or condition was imported, contains the county of origin of the disease or condition.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label
hl7v251.implementationNotes: Five digit numeric FIPS code

elements.name: Transmission Mode
elements.description: Code for the mechanism by which disease or condition was acquired by the subject of the investigation.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Confirmation Method
elements.description: Code for the mechanism by which the case was classified, providing information about how the case classification status was derived.  More than one confirmation method may be indicated.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Confirmation Date
elements.description: If an investigation is confirmed as a case, the confirmation date is entered.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Case Class Status Code
elements.description: Status of the case/event as suspect, probable, confirmed, or not a case per CSTE/CDC/ surveillance case definitions.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: MMWR Week
elements.description: MMWR Week for which case information is to be counted for MMWR publication.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: MMWR Year
elements.description: MMWR Year (YYYY) for which case information is to be counted for MMWR publication.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: State Case ID
elements.description: States use this field to link NEDSS investigations back to their own state investigations.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Date of First Report to CDC
elements.description: Date the case was first reported to the CDC

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Date First Reported PHD
elements.description: Earliest date the case was reported to the public health department whether at the local, county, or state public health level

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Pregnancy status
elements.description: Indicates whether the patient was pregnant at the time of the event

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Legacy Case ID
elements.description: CDC uses this field to link current case notifications to case notifications submitted by a previous system (NETSS, STD-MIS, etc.)

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
Legacy Case ID is expected in the fifth component of the CWE datatype.

For a NETSS case ID, please use the following format:  
Case ID(6) - State(2) - Site(3) - Year(4)
ex:  CaseId01LAB2009

elements.name: Age at case investigation
elements.description: Subject age at time of case investigation.

hl7v251.messageContext: Observation/OBX Segment with this variable ID and label

elements.name: Age units at case investigation
elements.description: Subject age units at time of case investigation

hl7v251.messageContext: OBX-6-Units
hl7v251.implementationNotes:
Part of the INV2001 Observation/OBX Segment.

The UID and label are not passed in the message.
